measured_by: Risk aversion parameter (ω) in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “A related parameter ω … quantifies the risk aversion of an investor, i.e. the relative value they accord to the (certain) amount that they keep and do not invest.”

measured_by: Level-k thinking parameter in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “The most computationally complex parameter is the level of thinking (theory of mind (ToM) level)… Level k-thinking classifies beliefs about the nature of other players by the number of mentalizing steps they employ.”

measured_by: Planning parameter (number of future exchanges) in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “Next comes parameter … which quantifies the number of future exchanges to be taken into account in thinking forward. This is called the subject's planning horizon.”

measured_by: Positive inequality aversion parameter (α) in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “We start with positive inequality aversion or guilt, ∈ {0, 0.4, 1}. This quantifies how sensitive a subject is to advantageous unequal outcomes.”

measured_by: Irritability parameter in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “Parameter ∈{0,0.25,0.5,0.75,1}, called irritability, which provides a model of punishment actions…”

measured_by: Irritation belief parameter (ζ) in the I-POMDP model of the Multi-Round Trust Game
justification: “Parameter (ζ) … called ‘irritation awareness’, governs … how sensitive agents are to the possibility of partner irritability.”
“We also collected … IQ (Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence (WASI) Score, see Weiss et al, 2010).”

measured_by: Neighbourhood ‘households in poverty index’ (Office for National Statistics, 2014)
justification: “Socio-Economic status (Neighbourhood 'households in poverty index' of the Office of National Statistics 2014).”
